ground_truth: Ezra sits playing the piano in the foyer of a modern glass and steel mall as people of all different ages mill in the area, going about their business. Ben stands in a shop doorway watching Ezra play, appearing deeply moved and drifting off into his own thoughts. In a diner, a couple cuddles and giggles, while nearby, Ezra, who's in his 40s, sips from a mug at a table where a pretty, blonde waitress speaks to him. Ben sits watching nearby as Susan walks off, then watches sympathetically, gets up, throws money onto his table, and saunters over to Ezra's table. Ezra, an attractive man with an aquiline nose and longish brown hair, self-consciously smooths down his hair, unaware of Ben standing over him. Ben looks down at the pie on a plate in front of Ezra, whose blue eyes are clouded, and a look of surprise crosses Ezra's face as Ben goes. In Ben's motel, a single box jellyfish floats in his aquarium as Ben sits watching it. He sits motionless in the shadowy room, then goes to pick up his mobile, checks the display, and slowly opens it. Meanwhile, Emily is in the hospital lying in bed with air tubes running from her nose, fiddling with Ben's card. She holds her mobile away from her, looks at it briefly, snuggles down in the bed, and her smile fades. She closes her eyes and smiles, then her eyes are open again and she blinks, beginning to look drowsy. Phone to his ear, Ben walks towards the main door of the St. Matthew Center. The glass doors slide apart and he enters, walks down a hospital corridor towards Emily's room, stops outside her room, and looks at her through the window as Emily lies fast asleep surrounded by machines and monitors. Ben closes his clamshell mobile phone while Emily lies on her side with her ear pressed against her phone on a pillow. Ben slowly and gently pulls the phone out and shuts it, then stands looking down at her tenderly, puts Emily's phone on the bed, draws up a chair, and sits at her bedside, staring down at her peaceful but bruised face as she continues sleeping. Emily, asleep on her side, wakes, blinks drowsily, rubs her eyes as she slowly comes to, sits up a little, freezes, then sits up fully. She stares down at Ben, slumped back in the chair beside her bed, fast asleep. Removing the oxygen tubes from her nose, Emily watches Ben, then slowly reaches out and caresses the back of one of his hands with her fingertips.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Ezra perches playing the piano in the foyer of a contemporary glass and steel shopping center as individuals of all various ages mill in the vicinity, going about their affairs. Ben stands in a store entrance observing Ezra perform, appearing profoundly stirred and drifting off into his own musings. In a diner, a duo cuddles and giggles, while nearby, Ezra, who's in his 40s, sips from a mug at a table where a lovely, blonde waitress converses with him. Ben sits observing nearby as Susan walks off, then watches sympathetically, rises, tosses currency onto his table, and saunters over to Ezra's table. Ezra, an attractive man with an aquiline nose and longish brown hair, self-consciously smooths down his hair, unaware of Ben standing over him. Ben looks downward at the pie on a plate in front of Ezra, whose azure eyes are clouded, and a look of astonishment traverses Ezra's face as Ben departs. In Ben's motel, a solitary box jellyfish drifts in his aquarium as Ben sits observing it. He sits motionless in the dim room, then goes to pick up his cellular, checks the display, and slowly opens it. Meanwhile, Emily is in the hospital lying in bed with air tubes running from her nose, fiddling with Ben's card. She holds her cellular away from her, looks at it briefly, snuggles down in the bed, and her smile fades. She closes her eyes and smiles, then her eyes are open again and she blinks, starting to appear drowsy. Phone to his ear, Ben walks towards the main entryway of the St. Matthew Center. The glass doors slide apart and he enters, walks down a hospital corridor towards Emily's room, stops outside her room, and looks at her through the window as Emily lies fast asleep surrounded by machines and monitors. Ben closes his clamshell cellular phone while Emily lies on her side with her ear pressed against her phone on a cushion. Ben slowly and gently pulls the phone out and shuts it, then stands looking down at her tenderly, puts Emily's phone on the bed, draws up a chair, and sits at her bedside, staring down at her serene but bruised face as she continues slumbering. Emily, asleep on her side, wakes, blinks drowsily, rubs her eyes as she slowly comes to, sits up a little, freezes, then sits up fully. She stares down at Ben, slumped back in the chair beside her bed, fast asleep. Removing the oxygen tubes from her nose, Emily watches Ben, then slowly reaches out and caresses the back of one of his hands with her fingertips.

Ben slowly and gently pulls the phone out and shuts it, then stands looking down at her tenderly, puts Emily's phone on the bed, draws up a chair, and sits at her bedside, staring down at her peaceful but bruised face as she continues sleeping. Emily, asleep on her side, is waking, blinking drowsily, rubbing her eyes as she slowly comes to, sits up a little, freezes, then sits up fully. She is staring down at Ben, who is slumped back in the chair beside her bed, fast asleep. Removing the oxygen tubes from her nose, Emily is watching Ben, then slowly reaches out and caresses the back of one of his hands with her fingertips.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Ezra plays piano in a modern glass and steel mall foyer as people of all ages mill around. Ben stands in a shop doorway, deeply moved while watching Ezra play. In a diner, a couple cuddles and laughs nearby as Ezra, in his 40s, sips from a mug at a table where a blonde waitress speaks to him. Ben watches, then leaves money on his table and approaches Ezra. Ezra, an attractive man with an aquiline nose and long brown hair, smooths his hair, unaware of Ben over him. Ben looks at the pie in front of Ezra, whose blue eyes are clouded, surprising Ezra as Ben leaves. In Ben's motel, a jellyfish floats in his aquarium as Ben checks his mobile. Emily lies in a hospital bed, fiddling with Ben's card, then snuggles down, her smile fading and eyes drowsy. Ben, phone to ear, enters the St. Matthew Center, walks to Emily's room, and looks at her sleeping. He closes his phone while Emily lies with her phone on a pillow; he gently places it on the bed, draws up a chair, and watches her bruised face as she sleeps. Emily wakes, rubs her eyes, freezes, then sits fully up. She sees Ben asleep beside her, removes her oxygen tubes, and gently caresses his hand.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Ezra plays piano in a modern mall, as people pass by and Ben, watching from a doorway, seems deeply moved. In a diner, a couple cuddles while Ezra, in his 40s, talks to a waitress and drinks from a mug. Nearby, Ben observes, gets up, and approaches Ezra's table. Ezra, an attractive man with brown hair, smooths his hair unaware of Ben. Ben looks at Ezra's pie, and Ezra is surprised as Ben leaves. In Ben's motel, he watches a jellyfish in an aquarium, then checks his mobile. Meanwhile, in the hospital, Emily, in bed with air tubes, holds Ben's card. She examines her mobile, her smile fading, then blinks drowsily. Ben heads to St. Matthew Center, enters, and approaches Emily's room, watching her through the window as she sleeps. He closes his phone, gently removes Emily's phone, and sits at her bedside. Emily wakes, sees Ben asleep in a chair beside her, removes her oxygen tubes, and caresses his hand.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Ezra is seated, gently playing the piano in the spacious foyer of a sleek, modern mall, characterized by its impressive glass and steel structure. Shoppers of various ages mill about the area, each preoccupied with their own errands and tasks. In the doorway of a nearby shop, Ben stands with his eyes fixed on Ezra as he skillfully plays the piano. Ben appears to be deeply moved by the music, his thoughts drifting elsewhere. Meanwhile, in a bustling diner not too far away, a couple can be seen cuddling and giggling lightheartedly. Ezra, who is in his 40s, sits quietly, sipping from a mug at a table. A pretty, blonde waitress stops by to speak with him. Sitting nearby, Ben watches with interest as Susan walks away. He watches empathetically before he rises, casually throws some money onto his table, and saunters over to where Ezra is seated. Ezra, an attractive man with striking features, including an aquiline nose and longish brown hair, self-consciously smooths down his hair, seemingly unaware of Ben standing over him. With a thoughtful look, Ben glances down at the pie sitting on the plate in front of Ezra, whose sharp blue eyes appear clouded. A look of surprise flits across Ezra's face as Ben turns to leave. 

In the dimly lit confines of Ben's motel room, a single box jellyfish floats serenely in his aquarium, casting an ethereal glow in the room. Ben sits motionless, watching the jellyfish before he reaches for his mobile phone, checks the display with a sense of hesitation, and slowly flips it open. Meanwhile, Emily is in the hospital, lying in bed with air tubes running from her nose. She absentmindedly fiddles with Ben's card. Holding her mobile at a distance, she glances at it fleetingly before snuggling further into her bed. Her smile fades momentarily, then she closes her eyes, and a gentle smile reappears. Her eyes flutter open again, blinking slowly, as she begins to look drowsy. 

With his phone pressed to his ear, Ben walks purposefully towards the main entrance of the St. Matthew Center. The large glass doors slide apart with a soft whoosh, allowing him to enter. He walks down the sterile hospital corridor, heading toward Emily's room. Stopping just outside her room, he gazes at her through the window as she lies in deep slumber, surrounded by a multitude of machines and monitors. Ben quietly closes his clamshell mobile phone as Emily continues to rest on her side with her ear pressed against her phone, which lies on the pillow beside her. Ben gently removes the phone from her ear and closes it softly. Then, he stands over her with a tender expression, placing Emily's phone on the bed. He pulls up a chair, sits at her bedside, and looks down at her bruised yet peaceful face as she remains asleep. 

Gradually, Emily, who is resting on her side, wakes up. Her eyes blink drowsily, and she rubs them gently as she slowly regains her awareness. She sits up a bit, appears to freeze for a moment, then sits up fully. She stares at Ben, who is slumped back in the chair next to her bed, fast asleep. Carefully removing the oxygen tubes from her nose, Emily watches Ben. She then slowly reaches out and tenderly caresses the back of one of his hands with the tips of her fingers.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Ezra finds himself comfortably seated, gently playing the piano in the expansive and open foyer of a sleek, ultra-modern mall, distinguished by its impressive design of shimmering glass and sturdy steel. Around him, shoppers of various ages can be seen milling about, each absorbed in their own errands and daily tasks. Nearby, in the doorway of a close shop, Ben is positioned with his eyes intently fixed on Ezra as he plays the piano with skill and grace. Ben appears to be profoundly moved by the music, his thoughts seemingly drifting to far-off places. Meanwhile, in a lively diner not situated too far away, a couple can be witnessed cuddling closely and giggling with lightheartedness. Ezra, who is in his 40s, sits quietly, sipping thoughtfully from a mug at one of the tables. A pretty, blonde waitress approaches to speak with him cheerfully. Sitting nearby, Ben watches the interaction with interest as Susan eventually walks away. He observes with empathy before he rises, casually tossing some money onto his table, and then saunters over to where Ezra is seated. Ezra, an attractive man with striking features, including a distinguished aquiline nose and longish brown hair, self-consciously smooths down his hair, seemingly unaware of Ben standing over him. With a pensive look, Ben glances down at the pie resting on the plate in front of Ezra, whose sharp blue eyes seem momentarily clouded. A look of surprise briefly flits across Ezra's face as Ben turns to make his exit.

In the dimly lit and intimate confines of Ben's motel room, a single, captivating box jellyfish floats serenely in his aquarium, casting a soft, ethereal glow throughout the room. Ben sits motionless, watching the jellyfish with intent before he reaches for his mobile phone. Checking the display with a hint of hesitation, he slowly flips it open. Meanwhile, Emily is in the hospital, lying quietly in bed with air tubes extending from her nose. She idly fiddles with Ben's card. Holding her mobile at a distance, she glances at it fleetingly before snuggling deeper into her bed. Her smile fades momentarily, but then she closes her eyes, and a gentle smile reemerges. Her eyes flutter open once more, blinking slowly, as she begins to look drowsy.

With his phone pressed snugly to his ear, Ben strides purposefully towards the main entrance of the St. Matthew Center. The large glass doors part with a soft whoosh, graciously allowing him to enter. He walks down the sterile, clean hospital corridor, making his way toward Emily's room. Halting just outside her room, he gazes at her through the window as she lies in deep slumber, surrounded by a multitude of machines and monitoring equipment. Ben quietly closes his clamshell mobile phone as Emily continues to rest on her side with her ear pressed against her phone, which lies on the pillow beside her. Ben gently removes the phone from her ear and closes it softly. Then, he stands over her with a tender expression, placing Emily's phone gently on the bed. He pulls up a chair, sitting at her bedside, and looks down at her bruised yet peaceful face as she remains asleep.

Gradually, Emily, still resting on her side, begins to wake up. Her eyes blink drowsily, and she gently rubs them as she slowly regains her awareness. She sits up slightly, appears to freeze for a moment, then sits up fully. She stares at Ben, who is slumped back in the chair next to her bed, sound asleep. Carefully moving, she removes the oxygen tubes from her nose, watching Ben closely. Then, she slowly reaches out and tenderly caresses the back of one of his hands with the delicate tips of her fingers.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Ezra is seated at a piano in the foyer of a modern, sleek mall, constructed from glass and steel, with his fingers gliding across the keys. As the music fills the air, people of all ages move about the space, each engaged in their own activities. Meanwhile, Ben stands just inside the doorway of a shop, his eyes fixed on Ezra as he plays. Ben's expression is one of deep emotion, as if the music has transported him into a realm of personal reflection. In a nearby diner, a couple is nestled closely together, sharing laughter and affection. At another table, Ezra, now clearly in his 40s, takes a sip from a mug. A pretty, blonde waitress stands at his side, engaged in conversation with him. Ben, who has been observing from a nearby table, watches as the waitress, Susan, walks away. A sympathetic look crosses his face. He then pushes his chair back, stands up, tosses some money onto his table, and makes his way over to where Ezra is seated. Ezra, with his attractive features, aquiline nose, and slightly long brown hair, is momentarily preoccupied, smoothing down his hair without noticing Ben's presence. Ben approaches and glances down at the slice of pie placed before Ezra. Ezra's blue eyes, though clouded, suddenly register surprise as he realizes Ben is there, but Ben turns to leave. Later, in the dimly lit space of Ben's motel room, a solitary box jellyfish drifts within the confines of an aquarium. Ben sits still, enveloped in the room's shadows, his gaze fixed on the jellyfish's fluid movements. He then reaches for his mobile phone, examines the display for a moment, and slowly flips it open. Meanwhile, in a hospital room, Emily lies in bed with tubes providing her with air, her fingers fiddling with a card from Ben. She holds her mobile at a distance, casting a brief glance at the screen before nestling back into her bed. Her smile wavers, then returns briefly as she closes her eyes, only for them to flutter open again, her demeanor growing drowsy. With the phone pressed to his ear, Ben strides towards the entrance of the St. Matthew Center. As the glass doors slide apart, he steps inside, making his way through the hospital corridors until he reaches Emily's room. He pauses outside the door, peering through the window at Emily, who is deep in slumber, encircled by the steady hum of machines and the glow of monitors. After closing his clamshell mobile phone, Ben notices Emily lying on her side, her phone resting against her ear on the pillow. With a gentle hand, he eases the phone away and closes it softly. Standing there, he gazes down at her with tenderness before placing the phone on the bed. He draws a chair closer, sits beside her, and watches over her bruised but serene face as she sleeps soundly. Gradually, Emily stirs from her slumber, blinking with a sleepy gaze, and tentatively rubbing her eyes. As she awakens further, she sits up partially, hesitates, then sits up fully, her eyes fixed on Ben, who is now slumped in the chair beside her bed, lost in sleep. Gently removing the oxygen tubes from her nose, Emily's eyes remain on Ben. With deliberate care, she reaches forward and touches the back of his hand with her fingertips, caressing it softly.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Ezra plays the piano in the foyer of a modern mall, drawing the attention of passersby, including Ben, who stands in a shop doorway, deeply moved. Meanwhile, in a diner, Ezra, a middle-aged man with striking features, chats with a waitress while sipping from a mug. Observing from a distance, Ben eventually approaches Ezra's table, surprising him. Later, in his motel, Ben watches a jellyfish in his aquarium before checking his mobile phone. Concurrently, Emily, hospitalized and connected to air tubes, examines Ben's card and her phone with a mix of emotions.  

Ben enters the St. Matthew Center, walks through the hospital, and pauses at Emily's room, observing her asleep amidst medical equipment. After closing his mobile phone, he gently removes Emily's phone from her grasp and settles into a chair at her bedside, watching her tenderly. When Emily awakens, she quietly removes the oxygen tubes, then reaches out to caress Ben's hand as he sleeps slumped in the chair.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Ezra sits playing the piano in the foyer of a modern glass and steel mall, a bustling shopping center renowned for its cutting-edge architectural design, as people of all different ages mill in the area, going about their business. Ben stands in a shop doorway watching Ezra play, appearing deeply moved and drifting off into his own thoughts that sway like the melodies. In a classic American diner styled to evoke the 1950s, a couple cuddles and giggles, while nearby, Ezra, who's in his 40s and known in the area for his musical talent, sips from a mug at a table where a pretty, blonde waitress on her regular shift speaks to him. Ben sits watching nearby as Susan, who frequents the diner, walks off, then watches sympathetically, gets up, throws money onto his table, and saunters over to Ezra's table. Ezra, an attractive man with an aquiline nose and longish brown hair reminiscent of classical musicians, self-consciously smooths down his hair, unaware of Ben standing over him. Ben looks down at the pie on a plate in front of Ezra, whose blue eyes are clouded with unspoken thoughts, and a look of surprise crosses Ezra's face as Ben goes. In Ben's motel room, which includes a large fish tank, a single box jellyfish floats in his aquarium, an unusual pet choice, as Ben sits watching it. He sits motionless in the shadowy room, then goes to pick up his mobile, a now dated flip phone, checks the display, and slowly opens it. Meanwhile, Emily is in the hospital lying in bed with air tubes running from her nose, a common setup for patients needing assistance with breathing, fiddling with Ben's card. She holds her mobile away from her, looks at it briefly, snuggles down in the bed, and her smile fades. She closes her eyes and smiles, then her eyes are open again and she blinks, beginning to look drowsy. Phone to his ear, Ben walks towards the main door of the St. Matthew Center, a well-respected medical facility known for its compassionate care. The glass doors slide apart and he enters, walks down a hospital corridor towards Emily's room, stops outside her room, and looks at her through the window as Emily lies fast asleep surrounded by machines and monitors that track her vital signs. Ben closes his clamshell mobile phone while Emily lies on her side with her ear pressed against her phone on a pillow. Ben slowly and gently pulls the phone out and shuts it, then stands looking down at her tenderly, puts Emily's phone on the bed, draws up a chair, and sits at her bedside, staring down at her peaceful but bruised face as she continues sleeping. Emily, asleep on her side, wakes, blinks drowsily, rubs her eyes as she slowly comes to, sits up a little, freezes, then sits up fully. She stares down at Ben, slumped back in the chair beside her bed, fast asleep. Removing the oxygen tubes from her nose, a sign she feels slightly better, Emily watches Ben, then slowly reaches out and caresses the back of one of his hands with her fingertips, a gentle gesture of gratitude and affection.

Ben stands in a shop doorway watching Ezra play appearing deeply moved and drifting off into his own thoughts. In a diner a couple cuddles and giggles while nearby. Ezra who is in his 40s sips from a mug at a table where a pretty blonde waitress speaks to him. Ben sits watching nearby as Susan walks off then watches sympathetically gets up throws money onto his table and saunters over to Ezra's table. Ben closes his clamshell mobile phone while Emily lies on her side with her ear pressed against her phone on a pillow. Ben slowly and gently pulls the phone out and shuts it then stands looking down at her tenderly puts Emily's phone on the bed draws up a chair and sits at her bedside staring down at her peaceful but bruised face as she continues sleeping. Emily asleep on her side wakes blinks drowsily rubs her eyes as she slowly comes to sits up a little freezes then sits up fully. She stares down at Ben slumped back in the chair beside her bed fast asleep. Removing the oxygen tubes from her nose. Emily watches Ben then slowly reaches out and caresses the back of one of his hands with her fingertips.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Ezra sits playing the piano in the foyer of a modern glass and steel mall as people of all different ages mill in the area going about their business. Ben stands in a shop doorway watching Ezra play appearing deeply moved and drifting off into his own thoughts. She stares down at Ben slumped back in the chair beside her bed fast asleep. Removing the oxygen tubes from her nose. Emily watches Ben then slowly reaches out and caresses the back of one of his hands with her fingertips.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Toby lounges strumming the ukulele in the lobby of a vintage brick and wood bridge as animals of all different species wander in the forest, chasing after their adventures. Mia leans against a shrub entryway observing Toby strum, appearing intensely indifferent and dozing off into her own memories. In a barn, a trio wrestles and snickers, while nearby, Toby, who's in his 60s, gulps from a goblet at a bench where a curious, red-haired gardener whispers to him. Mia lounges observing nearby as Mark skips out, then observes nostalgically, leaps up, drops pebbles onto his bench, and dances over to Toby's booth. Toby, a striking woman with a round face and curly gray locks, nervously pats down her skirt, oblivious to Mia hovering over her. Mia gazes up at the cake on a platter beneath Toby, whose green glasses are foggy, and a look of confusion crosses Toby's gaze as Mia departs. In Mia's cave, a single snow hare hops in her terrarium as Mia lounges admiring it. She lounges agilely in the illuminated burrow, then strolls to lift up her radio, scans the screen, and grudgingly fastens it. Meanwhile, Oliver is on the ship reclining on a hammock with snorkeling gear hanging from his toes, scribbling on Mia's map. He shields his camera around him, peers at it briefly, dozes off in the hammock, and his grin fades. He shuts his eyes and chuckles, then his eyes are open again and he yawns, beginning to look hungry. Stereo to her mouth, Mia glides towards the central gate of the Bastion Mountain Warehouse. The wooden gates tilt together and she departs, glides up a school passage towards Oliver's cabin, halts within his cabin, and stares at him from under the ceiling as Oliver dozes soundly surrounded by owls and fires. Mia fastens her rotary stereo while Oliver dozes on his back with his fingers pressed against his stereo on a blanket. Mia clumsily and playfully dials the stereo in and fastens it, then stands staring up at him tenderly, places Oliver's stereo on the counter, draws up a camel, and lounges beside his hammock, admiring up at his serene but rumpled hat as he continues dreaming. Oliver, dreaming on his back, jolts awake, yawns sleepily, scratches his cheek as he quickly starts to, jumps up a bit, pauses, then stands up completely. He gawks up at Mia, sprawled forward on the pony beside his blanket, completely dreaming. Removing the snorkeling gear from his toes, Oliver admires Mia, then quickly stretches out and tickles the back of one of her knees with his knuckles.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Ezra plays piano in a mall, observed by Ben, who is deeply moved. Later, in a diner, Ezra sips his drink, unaware that Ben watches him before leaving. At Ben's motel, he observes a jellyfish and checks his phone. Meanwhile, Emily lies in a hospital bed, holding Ben's card as she looks at her phone and smiles drowsily. Ben enters the hospital, stops at Emily's room, and sees her sleeping. He closes his phone, sits by her bedside, and tenderly watches over her. Emily wakes, sees Ben asleep, removes her oxygen tubes, and gently caresses his hand.
